newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: Zimbabwe share index leaps to new record high.
newsitem.headline: Zimbabwe share index leaps to new record high.

text.p: Zimbabwean industrial shares traded predictably bullish on Wednesday, and the main industrial index surged over 52 points to a new record high of 8,179.86, for the second day running.

Brokers said both local and foreign investors -- individuals and corporates -- continued to trade on current forecasts that the southern African state's economy will grow by 5-7 percent next year from an estimated five percent in 1996.
"It's the same trend. The market remains generally bullish although we can expect to get some hiccups and volatility here and there in response to news from specific companies," one broker said.

"Investor interest is broad but I think it will soon narrow to the heavyweights and the conglomerates. For now, price offers and bids remain high and balanced...and should stay that way for a while," he added.

On Wednesday, the 57-counter industrial index jumped 52.03 points to its record level on broad support, but some brokers said 10-cent gains in transport group Clan at 330, banking group Finhold at 850 Cnd sugar producer Hippo Valley at 930 had added the most weight.
Gold producer Rio Tinto's 350 cents drop to 3,300 on minings ploughed the secondary seven-share mining index 24.86 points down to 1,176.21.
